name: 42 Macro
title: The Macro Minute: Will DOGE Save The Bond Market And, By Extension, The Bull Markets In Risk Assets?
text:
Synopsis
The Treasury General Account (TGA) drawdown could potentially provide positive liquidity dynamics for both domestic and global markets, with approximately $660 billion expected to trend towards zero in the next 4-5 months, while broader market performance remains contingent on complex interactions between growth, inflation, policy, and liquidity cycles.

Key Insights
- Recent market observations show steep sell-offs in risk assets and bonds, indicating persistent inflation challenges
- Bond yields have dropped approximately 75 basis points on a real basis since the Federal Reserve began cutting policy rates in September
- President Trump suggested interest rates are too high and may implement economic strategies including tariffs and spending cuts
- The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is attempting to reduce federal government size, but faces limitations with major spending categories like Social Security and Medicare
- Previous TGA drawdown cycles in late 2021 and first half of 2023 showed modest market gains:
  - S&P 500 increased around 4%
  - Bitcoin appreciated 15-20%
- Investors must consider four critical market cycles: growth, inflation, policy (monetary and fiscal), and liquidity
- Market focus is typically limited, concentrating on one or two primary factors at a time
- Liquidity dynamics can significantly influence asset markets, but can be overwhelmed by other economic cycles
